statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Xavier 80, Eastern Illinois 35
article.story: CINCINNATI (AP) -- Brian Thornton scored 20 points and Xavier's retooled defense limited Eastern Illinois to nine field goals during a season-opening 80-35 victory Saturday night. Josh Duncan added 12 points and Will Caudle had 11 as Xavier pulled away to its most lopsided victory since a 108-57 win over Long Island on Dec. 8, 2001. The Musketeers went 17-12 last season with a young lineup that had trouble defending and winning close games. Their top seven players returned, and coach Sean Miller has emphasized defense in preseason workouts. Xavier's defense looked good against a team going through major adjustments on offense. Eastern Illinois went only 9-of-49 from the field -- an 18.4 shooting percentage that was its all-time low in Division I. Josh Gomes was the only Eastern Illinois player in double figures, finishing with 11 points. The Panthers scored 15 of their points on free throws and went 2-of-15 from behind the 3-point arc. Eastern Illinois fired coach Rick Samuels following a 12-16 finish last season, his 25th at the school. Replacement Mike Miller has made major changes, getting away from the motion offense that Samuels favored. The Panthers showed they've got a long way to go in their transition. Xavier pulled ahead 38-18 in the first half, and Dedrick Finn made a 3-pointer that pushed the lead to 47-20 with 17:11 left. Xavier led by as many as 46 points in the second half.
